Title: Farinelli
Writer: Andrée Corbiau (original scenario), Gérard Corbiau (original scenario), Marcel Beaulieu (adaptation), Andrée Corbiau (adaptation), Gérard Corbiau (adaptation), Andrée Corbiau (dialogue)
Actors: Stefano Dionisi, Enrico Lo Verso, Elsa Zylberstein, Caroline Cellier
Plot: Farinelli, is the artistic name of Carlo Broschi, a young singer in Handel's time. He was castrated in his childhood in order to preserve his voice. During his life he becomes to be a very famous opera singer, managed by his mediocre brother (Riccardo).
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 6 wins & 3 nominations.
